title: Azir QoL Request- Please remove the announcement when Azir's tower dies
body: Whenever one of Azir's temporary towers dies, it gives the announcement that "your/enemy tower has been destroyed". While not having a huge impact of the overall game, it does cause moments of confusion as you are suddenly looking for which lane has minions pushing , who is splitting, etc. It would be far less confusing and irritating if that announcement was removed or it a unique announcement was made for the sundisk. Maybe a global audio clip referencing Shurima's fall or return. As long as it isnt the generic tower message.

replies.body: We do want to do this, but didn't have the time to dig into the announcement system for this patch (announcements are hard coded; we'll need to change this code to know the difference between a regular tower and an Azir tower. We'll get to it eventually!)

> I agree with this change and I'd also think that his soldiers should get health and be targetable. Most other champions with their own minions have that feature and it makes him a little overpowered. I just think it inspire better tactics to be used with placement and use of the soldiers.

Here's the thing about it though. Everybody says "Make his minions targetable"

And I say "If you can target them, then they will need health"

And if you give them health, then they will scale either off of his AP or his current Health.

Which means, instead of you just needing to wait 9 seconds for them to disappear, you'll have to wait until you KILL THEM.  And if you are a melee fighter, then you are stuck fighting Azir's soldiers until you kill them.  And he can summon another right after in 2-3 seconds if he has enough cooldown.

So, tell me. What's more broken? An untargetable minion who can't move on its own that lasts only 9 seconds?
Or a minion that can get up to over 1k in health and lasts indefinitely until killed.  Because at that point, instead of 3, he can have 5 and more if you don't kill them.

1. Sometimes Azir will attack an enemy in range of his soldier or vice versa
2. Sometimes Soldiers will not attack enemies in both azir's command range and their own
3. Sometimes Soldiers will fail to hit targets they have completed an attack animation for (I don't understand this one)
4. Sometimes Soldiers WILL NOT RESPOND TO command Q this is vital, it loses kills, it fails escapes and it misses cs (Seems to happen most often if you tell them to charge right after summoning them, if you do it to fast they seem to be dead to that command, just speculation)

The soldier wall are not units, but not a solid wall either, as far as I understand it.

Riven I wouldn't know...she'd have to be bounced back.
Trist jumps over the wall, not through it, as far as I know.
Kassadin and Janna ignore unit collision, not Sand Soldier Wall collision. They aren't units. Kassadin (and Ezreal) can teleport over the wall, though.
Fizz's ability is a jump. I doubt it matters if he's untargetable or not. While he can jump over regular game walls, Azir's might bounce him off (something other walls in the game, regular and champ-created, aren't programmed to do).
Vlad sinks into a pool and basically flows through the ground underneath the soldier wall, and comes up on the other side. When considering what the wall is supposed to do, that actually makes sense.

What about Gnar, though? Can he E over the wall? Can he use E to bounce off a sand soldier or the soldier wall? Does his R stun enemies knocked into Azir's soldier wall? Does Vayne's E stun enemies knocked into Azir's soldier wall?

Yea with riven/trist/fizz the game actually tries to rebound them, but when it is in the pushing portion of the spell enemies traveling forward at highspeed (IE enemies in a dash) wind up being rebounded several times in quick succession (you'll notice multiple spark animations on the wall and the enemy champ will appear to fly higher and higher, during this process one of the soldiers will not move forward as much as the rest (the one doing the rebounds) and it will cause the wall to form a broken line, and sometimes will also cause the enemy champ to rebound between the displaced soldier and the regular soldier until they seem to simply appear on one side or the other (about 50% of the time they just wind up right next to you on your side).
